page.title: 05ECOLOGY IN RAYDON
page.content: The railway line between Capel and Hadleigh was closed in 1966.Since then Babergh district council have allowed the line to develop as a nature walk.It is therefore a good example of controlled ecological succession.The walk cuts across farmland,in some parts high above the neighbouring fields.The central path has not become overgrown because it has a solid base of stone andnd clinker with little soil to support young seedlings and it is used frequently by people exercising their dogs. Along the edges of the line Hawthorn, Hazel,Blackthorn,Oak,Field maple and Elder trees have developed unrestrained.In some parts these have grown across the path to form a canopy. This has allowed shade loving plants such as lesser celandine,herb bennet and wood anemone to develop.
